greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle in which row n consists of the coefficients in Sum_{m=0..n} x^m * Product_{k=m+1..n} (1-k*x), as read by rows.
comment: If m=n, we have Sum_{k=0..n} A008277(n, k) = A000110(n) = Sum_{j=0..n} T(n,j)*A008277(2n-j,n) where A000110(n) is the n-th Bell number. - _Robert A. Russell_, Apr 08 2018
formula: Right border equals A000166, the subfactorial numbers.
Row sums equal A000166 (shift right 1 place).
Row sums of unsigned terms yields A002467(n) = n! - A000166(n).
Sum_{k=0..n} A008277(m, k) = Sum_{j=0..n} T(n, j)*A008277(m+n-j, n) where A008277(m, k) are Stirling subset numbers. - _Robert A. Russell_, Mar 30 2018
For k>0, T(n,k) = [k==n] + [k<n]*T(n-1,k) - n*T(n-1,k-1). - _Robert A. Russell_, Apr 25 2018
example: Compare the row g.f.s to the o.g.f. of Bell numbers (A000110):
mathematica: {m, 0, n}], x], n+1], {n, 0, 20}] // Flatten (* _Robert A. Russell_, Apr 08 2018 *)
Table[T[n, k], {n, 0, 15}, {k, 0, n}] // Flatten (* _Robert A. Russell_, Apr 25 2018 *)
results.author: _Paul D. Hanna_, Oct 16 2014
